intro: Ouratea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded environments. The botanical features of Ouratea angustifolia make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
